structural_analysis.context_justification: The document contains the Sixth Valli (षष्ठी वल्ली). The first parsed unit is Mantra 1. Therefore, the starting coordinate is 6.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, commentary author slug, and zero-padded start ID (06-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Single Unit Chunking
proposed_strategy.description: The input comprises only a single major structural unit (Valli 6) plus extensive concluding material, totaling approximately 25,600 characters. Since this is well below the safety limit, the entire document is treated as one chunk to minimize processing overhead.

execution_plan.description: Complete Sixth Valli, including Mantras 1-18, the Uttarashanti, and the concluding Brahma Sutra commentary and colophon.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Valli is the context, but the Mantra is the primary, repeatable atomic unit for commentary, and each is clearly numbered.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed in double pipes (।। N ।।) found within the bolded Mantra text.

start_pattern.description: The start of a Mantra is marked by bolded text followed immediately by its number enclosed in double pipes, also bolded.

end_pattern.description: The end of the commentary section for a Mantra is marked by the same double-pipe numbering structure, typically placed at the end of the interpretation paragraph.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial document title (कठोपनिषत्) and Valli title (षष्ठी वल्ली) should be treated as structural headers, not parsable content units.
